condition.narrative: Ensure the project is implemented in accordance with provisions of the ESMF and carry out a screening procedure to determine if aresettlement plan is required under any Subproject under component 3
Ensure the recruitment of two agricultural extension officers per administrative post, in (i) first phase project district
The Recipient has recruited (i) 1 senior Financial Management Specialist, (ii) 1 Sr. Procurement Spec. (iii) 2 DistrictFacilitators, (iv) 1 Field Management Advisor
The Recipient has adopted the Project Operational Manual (OM) in form and substance satisfactory to the Association
The Recipient has established a Financial Management System (FMS) in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, to ensureproper execution and monitoring of project activities
The Recipient has recruited (i) 1 Accountant per Province, 1 accountant and 1 procurement officer per district, 1 supversoryprocurement officer and (ii) project Beneficiary shall have concluded a MOU
The Recipient has recruited a Procurement Officer at national level

title.narrative: [GEF] Increase in area with improved SLM and NRM practices in project area by at least:

comment.narrative: Generalized use of slash and burn as preferred cultivation system
Generalized use of slash and burn as preferred cultivation system; Environmentally friendly improved honey production.

title.narrative: Percent increase in agriculture income of participating households at the end of project period.

baseline.value: 5 districts: 8,295 MZNMorrumbala: 7,695 MZNMutarara: 9,040 MZNChemba: 13,130 MZNMopeia: 4,550 MZNMaringue: 10,690 MZN

comment.narrative: Reconstruction baseline using 2006 TIA (MINAG) and 2007 Census (INE); incl. categories: basic cultures, cassava and sweet potato,cash crop, cashew, cashew tree derivatives, coconut tree derivatives, livestock.
End-of-project survey is now being conducted to assess the final value of income increase among participating smallholders.

actual.value: 5 districts: 11,282 MZNMorrumbala: 13,257 MZNMutarara: 8,250 MZNChemba: 8,483 MZNMopeia: 10,719 MZNMaringue: 13,512 MZN

comment.narrative: As recommended in the previous SPN mission, the Project used data from the MINAG TIA 2012 to validate the estimations from thecommunity and HH survey conducted by the Project team in 2012.

title.narrative: [GEF] Number of NRM CAEIF projects under implementation (CAEIF-3 CBO projects)
Number of CBOs active in at least one sub-project supported by CAEIF
Number of members of Savings and Loans Groups (SLGs)

comment.narrative: This target has been reduced (initially 12,000) to reflect the outcomes of the restructuring approved May 23, 2012

title.narrative: Number of CBOs engaging in project supported organizational and institutional development activities
[GEF] Variable Infiltration Capacity (VIC) Distributed Hydrological model installed and operating

comment.narrative: The mission was informed that a VIC Model for the Zambezi River Basin has been calibrated and is now in the hands of ARA Zambeze.
